WorkoutType.Description: Stretching is a physical activity that involves lengthening and elongating muscles to improve flexibility, range of motion, and overall muscle function. It can help reduce muscle tension, increase blood flow, and prevent injuries. Stretching is often incorporated into warm-up and cool-down routines for various physical activities, including sports, exercise, and daily movements.

Cross-training involves diversifying your workout routine by incorporating various exercises and activities, such as running, swimming, cycling, or weightlifting. This approach targets different muscle groups, prevents overuse injuries, and enhances overall fitness levels while keeping workouts interesting and challenging.

SSteady state cardio involves performing aerobic exercise at a consistent intensity for an extended period, typically maintaining a steady heart rate. Examples include jogging, cycling, or using an elliptical machine. This type of cardio helps improve cardiovascular health, endurance, and calorie burning while being sustainable for longer durations.
